72314.title: textile panel; 'girls'
72314.title_notes: Environmental Enrichment Interior Panels for Herman Miller
72314.creation_notes:
collection: Environmental Enrichment Interior Panels for Herman Miller
Design rough cut number: 3001
72314.description: A multi-colored silk screen printed on an undyed plain weave cellulosic fabric.  The image is of a group of five girls in dresses, one holding a puppy and another holding a doll.  The textile is wrapped around a piece of 1 plywood with rounded corners.  It is stapled along all 4 edges, but also appears to be adhered to the surface of the plywood mount throughout.  A black painted wood frame is nailed to the back of the mount, an inch or so in from each side.  This frame functions to block the piece out from the wall when it is hung.
72314.credit_line: Gift of Irwin Management Company, Inc.
72314.medium_support: cotton, silk screen inks or dyes
72314.provenance: Alexander Girard for Herman Miller Furniture Company; Irwin Management Company, Inc., Columbus, Indiana; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 2012.
72314.inscription: stamp printed in the lower proper left corner:  Alexander Girard 1972

72312.title: textile panel; 'bouquet'
72312.title_notes: Environmental Enrichment Interior Panels for Herman Miller
72312.creation_notes:
collection: Environmental Enrichment Interior Panels for Herman Miller
Design rough cut number: 3022
72312.description: A bouquet of flowers silk screened in black on a mulit-colored striped fabrica Girard Mexicotton.  The fabric is plain weave and the stripes are created with various yarn dyed warp elements: orange, pink, natural (undyed), blue, red, light green, light pink, and light rust.  The design media (ink/dye) is very thick and sits on the surface of the fabric. The textile is mounted by being wrapped around a piece of  ¼ plywood with rounded corners.  It is stapled in place along all four edges.  There is an unpainted wood frame attached to the back of the mount board, an inch or so in from each edge, to block the piece out away from the wall when it is hung.
72312.credit_line: Gift of Irwin Management Company, Inc.
72312.medium_support: cotton, silk screen ink or dye
72312.provenance: Alexander Girard for Herman Miller Furniture Company; Irwin Management Company, Inc., Columbus, Indiana; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 2012.
72312.inscription: stamp silk screened in the lower proper left corner:  Alexander Girard 1972
